page.title: 06BOXWORTH - EXPERIMENTAL FARM
page.content: The experimental work is concentrated on arable crops (mainly cereals) and an Autumn-calving Frisian dairy herd. The ley grass fields for the herd are kept close to the farm buildings, the arable fields further out. Winter wheat has been grown continuously for 34 years on one part but break-crop rotation is also practsed with oilseed rape or beans. The 120 cows are fed with different types of grass and calves are bred from a Frisian bull and an Aberdeen Angus. Artificial insemination is also practiced. The farm and its 30 employees is in Boxworth for purely scientific reasons and not as a demonstration farm. Visitors are encouraged and there is an open day every year.
